content: So a while ago I setup Linkifiers in Zulip for automatic linking to GitHub issues and PRs. I had an issue with linking to any repo with a . in the name (e.g. github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org), so I sent an email to Zulip help. They just replied (apologising for the delay) and explained that . does indeed work in the Linkifier regex, I was just doing it wrong: I had [a-zA-Z0-9_-.] which it took _-. to mean any character between _ and . which isn't valid, so I couldn't do it. Zulip support pointed out I should simply do [a-zA-Z0-9_.-] instead which of course works. So I've updated the Linkifier regex and now you can link to any repo's issue/PR!

E.g. backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org#123

SEO: optimize the site for people looking for a CMS · Issue #123 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Follow-up from #122

I believe that this would have also worked: [a-zA-Z0-9_-\.]
(\escapes dots)
So how do we use it? Paste a link or type an issue id?

@Herb Either. Pasting URLs will automatically make them clickable (as you'd expect) but if you know the issue number you can just write it after a hash sign: #234 becomes #234

[Followup] Convert page.tpl.php to HTML5 · Issue #234 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
As per title, probably changes and discussion here is going to pend on usage of the new sectioning and grouping elements such as < header >, < hgroup > and < footer >.
And any links will automatically trigger a preview/teaser to be shown too.
